Posts.Content: klo289 wrote: I finally go for a mammogram this afternoon.  I am just hoping that they are able to see the lump.  It would be really nice to have some idea of what it is.  I'm kinda nervous, but relieved that it is finally happening.  I just really want to know something....good or bad.....I just can't keep worrying because I don't know.  I'll keep you posted on what they say....hopefully I'll know something today.... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Well, today is my mammogram klo289 LaughingWater

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2008 01:45PM klo289 wrote: Well, today was extremely frustrating.  They were not able to see the lump at all with the mammagram.  My doctor really didn't think they would see anything since my breasts are dense due to my age.  They had me wait for the radiologist to look over the images, but he said that he didn't need anymore and that he would send a report to my doctor.  The lady who did the mammogram seemed really confused by the fact that the lump wouldn't show up.  She said that she guessed it was because it was so deep in the breast and the denseness was blocking it. I'm just getting really tired of not knowing anything.  So now, I guess I'll just have to wait until they remove it before I have any idea what's going on.
Posts.Title: Well, today is my mammogram klo289 LaughingWater

Posts.Content: klo289 wrote: In reading another post, I noticed someone mentioning prominent veins on her breast in connection with invasive lubolar cancer.  This made me very curious, because I recently had an u/s and mammo to check on a lump.  The lump did not show up on either test.  They are now saying that it is just breast thickening in that area.  I have read how ivc is often not seen on u/s or mammo and is often mistaken for breast thickening.  I was curious as to if anyone knows what the signifigance of the veins being prominent on the breast are.  For several months, I have noticed that the veins on that particular breast are very bright and noticable.  One vein in particular is bright blue and raised....almost looks as if someone has drawn it on with a marker.  You can barely see any of the veins in my other breast.  I have found it odd for quite a while that this vein looks like that....now I am wondering if it is something that I should point out to my doctor.  Thanks. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: prominent veins on breast klo289 TenderIsOurMight
